author: A_Brickset_user
title: Not bad.
review: This was one of my first Technic sets. It's not bad either, for a small set. It has a little shock in the back for suspension, like most other technic sets, the wheel turns. It doesn't come with a little Technic fig. I give it a 7/10

author: A_Brickset_user
title: STURDY and FUN
review:
Hey, you know I was really surprised how much I liked mine. I got it for parts, but can't seem to bring myself to take it apart! I looks cool! It's sturdy and fun to play with! At the time, I paid $4.85 for mine, but now I would pay $10.00 FOR IT!

Really satisfied.

author: YeahYeahYouWere
title: Awesome and Fun
review:
As this set came out in 1996, I would have been 13 years old when I received it.  Thus, my skill with Technic would have been considered 'above' this little set.  But, that doesn't change the fact that I really loved this little set.  It was a very quick and simple build, but the end product was just fun.  I found this little set to be very endearing, especially because it had 2 working 'features' (the suspension and the steerings), which was a great attribute for such a small set.  Also, it came with a figure, and those guys provided me with hours of action figure adventure!

This little set was pretty solid, all things considered, and it was a very simple assembly/disassembly.  I really got a lot of mileage out of this little set, getting more out of it than I got out of many of my larger and much more expensive sets.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Technic - Dune Duster Review
review:
This is not my favourite LEGO Technic set but it's still a good set to get for pieces. This is an easy built and you also get a few stickers which you need to put on. We also get an instruction for a second model you can build with the pieces of this set. There're not many play features in this set but it's still worth the money. We get a steering weel which makes the tyres in the front moving to the right and to the left and a cool spring mechanism on the tyres on the back. I also like the choice of the colors of this vehicle. This model does have a good look but it doesn't have many play features. It's a good set to start your LEGO Technic collection with as well.


All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

author: brixton
title: Dune Buggy
review: This is my favorite technic set.  The pieces in this set that are completely amazing are the wheels, steering wheel, rack n pinion steering, the suspension in the back and the seat.  The stickers actually work really well in this set and I am no fan of stickers.  So that says a lot.  The tube piece is unique and adds an extra bit of flair to the finished product.
